headline.main: Ugly Duckling Turns Out to Be Formidable In the Air

lead_paragraph: In the vast armada of sleek jet fighters, helicopter gunships and cruise missiles that have pounded Afghanistan from the air, the unmanned drone known as the Predator is a decidedly ugly duckling. An ungainly, propeller-driven craft that flies as slowly as 80 miles per hour and is operated by remote control, the RQ-1 Predator has nonetheless proved a formidable weapon as the war enters its most complex phase: the hunt for the leadership of Al Qaeda and the Taliban.
abstract: Unmanned drone known as Predator proves formidable weapon as war in Afghanistan enters its most complex phase, hunt for leadership of Al Qaeda and Taliban; Predator is ungainly, propeller-driven craft that flies as slowly as 80 mph and is operated by remote control; CIA recently used it to coordinate surgical strike in which one of Osama bin Laden's closest lieutenants, Muhammad Atef, was killed; military experts say ability to fly armed, unmanned drones is significant advance for search-and-destroy missions on battlefield; say Predator permits US to hit targets as soon as they are sighted, instead of waiting for fighter-bombers to respond; diagram (M)
